contents: <sup>1</sup>Tardigrades are tiny, eight-legged animals that live in water. <sup>2</sup>Even if they are denied food and water for a decade, tardigrades can rehydrate. <sup>3</sup>Tardigrades can survive a broad range of extreme temperatures. <sup>4</sup>They can live under pressure approximately six times greater than the deepest ocean trenches. <sup>5</sup>These tiny creatures withstand hundreds of times the amount of ionizing radiation that would kill a person and can even live in the vacuum of space. <sup>6</sup>Tardigrades are strange and interesting animals, even though they are small.
